prompt: Analyze the role of observational learning in shaping human behavior. Refer to Bandura Social Learning Theory and include discussion of concepts like modelling, vicarious reinforcement, and self-efficacy. Provide real-life examples and discuss implications for education or media.

criteria.name: Understanding of Social Learning Theory
criteria.description: Demonstrates knowledge of Banduras theory and related concepts.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Accurately explains key components: modelling, vicarious reinforcement, attention, retention, reproduction, motivation, and self-efficacy.
performance_descriptors.good: Explains theory with minor gaps in conceptual coverage.
performance_descriptors.average: Covers basics of theory but omits important elements.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Limited or unclear understanding of Social Learning Theory.
performance_descriptors.poor: Fails to explain the theory meaningfully.

criteria.name: Application to Real-Life Contexts
criteria.description: Applies observational learning to behavior in education, media, or social settings.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Uses strong, specific examples to illustrate how people learn through observation and reinforcement.
performance_descriptors.good: Examples are clear but may lack detail or variety.
performance_descriptors.average: Applies theory, but examples are vague or underexplained.

criteria.name: Critical Evaluation and Implications
criteria.description: Evaluates strengths and weaknesses of observational learning and its broader implications.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Thoughtfully evaluates theory and discusses implications for learning and media effects.
performance_descriptors.good: Addresses both strengths and limitations with reasonable insight.

criteria.name: Academic Style and Referencing
criteria.description: Maintains academic tone and uses APA-style referencing.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Well-structured, formal writing with accurate APA citations throughout.
performance_descriptors.good: Mostly formal and coherent with minor citation issues.
performance_descriptors.average: Readable but inconsistent tone or referencing.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Writing lacks formality or has frequent citation errors.

key_points: Define observational learning and explain its stages: attention, retention, reproduction, motivation.
Discuss key concepts such as modelling, vicarious reinforcement, and self-efficacy.
Explain Banduras Bobo doll experiment and how it demonstrated learning through observation.
Apply Social Learning Theory to educational settings (e.g., classroom behavior, role models) and media influence (e.g., aggression, prosocial behavior).
Evaluate the strengths (e.g., real-world relevance) and limitations (e.g., underestimating biological factors) of the theory.
Use APA-style citations for Bandura and related research studies.
llm_questions: What are the main components of Banduras Social Learning Theory?
Can you explain the concept of vicarious reinforcement with an example?
What is the Bobo doll experiment and what did it demonstrate?
How does self-efficacy influence whether someone imitates a model?
In what ways is observational learning used in classrooms or media environments?
What are some criticisms or limitations of Social Learning Theory?
How do I cite Banduras 1961 study in APA format?
Can you help me outline an essay analyzing observational learning?
